title: Trump Canceling Planned Meeting With Russia’s Putin Over Ukraine Situation
content:
President Trump on Thursday canceled a planned meeting with Russian leader Vladimir Putin set for this weekend , citing Russia ’ s recent seizure of three Ukrainian naval ships .
In recent days Mr. Trump has wavered about whether he would meet with his Russian counterpart at the Group of 20 summit meeting in Buenos Aires . Before leaving for the summit on Thursday morning , he told reporters outside the White House he would “ probably ” keep the appointment with Mr. Putin .
“ They ’ d like to have it , ” he said of the Russian leadership .
But soon after boarding Air Force One , Mr. Trump sent out a pair of tweets calling off the meeting , citing Russia ’ s recent actions against Ukraine . White House press secretary Sarah Sanders said Mr. Trump made the decision after a conversation aboard the plane with White House Chief of Staff John Kelly , Secretary of State Mike Pompeo and national security adviser John Bolton , who spoke by phone from Brazil .
Mr. Trump wrote that his cancellation was “ based on the fact that the ships and sailors have not been returned to Ukraine from Russia. ” He said that he was open to rescheduling his meeting with Mr. Putin “ as soon as this situation is resolved ! ”
The confrontation began when three Ukrainian naval vessels were traveling through the Kerch Strait , which connects the Black Sea to the Sea of Azov . Russia seized the vessels and detained crew members .
The Kremlin hasn ’ t been officially notified of Mr. Trump ’ s decision to cancel the meeting with Mr. Putin—but such a move would free up “ a couple more hours for useful meetings ” for Mr. Putin at the G-20 , Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov was cited as saying by Russian news agency Interfax .
Earlier in the week , U.S . Ambassador to the United Nations Nikki Haley warned Russia over the seizure of the ships .
Russian forces fired on and detained three Ukrainian naval vessels in the Black Sea , near the Crimean peninsula , a move that threatened to reignite tensions between Moscow and Kiev . Image : FSB Handout via RTR
Ms. Haley called the incident “ yet another reckless Russian escalation ” and said it would sour U.S.-Russia relations while increasing tensions with Ukraine . She said her comments had been coordinated with President Trump and Secretary of State Mike Pompeo .
Relations between Ukraine and Russia have been strained since Moscow annexed Crimea in 2014 and supported an armed uprising in eastern Ukraine .
Mr. Trump ’ s decision to call off the meeting came several hours after his former attorney , Michael Cohen , pleaded guilty to making false statements to Congress last year about efforts to build a Trump Tower in Moscow during the presidential campaign .
Mr. Cohen told Congress he had “ limited ” discussions about the proposed deal with Mr. Trump . In reality the discussions were “ more extensive , ” Mr. Cohen said . In comments to reporters Thursday , Mr. Trump said Mr. Cohen was lying in an effort to get a reduced prison sentence .
Mr. Trump has faced criticism from Democrats for appearing deferential to Mr. Putin , despite the U.S. intelligence community ’ s finding that Russia attempted to influence the 2016 presidential race to help Mr. Trump and damage his opponent , Hillary Clinton . Mr. Trump has denied any collusion with Russia , and Moscow has denied any interference .
Vladimir Putin is president of Russia . An editing mistake misidentified Mr. Putin in an earlier version of this article . ( Nov. 29 )
content_original:
President Trump on Thursday canceled a planned meeting with Russian leader Vladimir Putin set for this weekend, citing Russia’s recent seizure of three Ukrainian naval ships.

In recent days Mr. Trump has wavered about whether he would meet with his Russian counterpart at the Group of 20 summit meeting in Buenos Aires. Before leaving for the summit on Thursday morning, he told reporters outside the White House he would “probably” keep the appointment with Mr. Putin.

“They’d like to have it,” he said of the Russian leadership.

But soon after boarding Air Force One, Mr. Trump sent out a pair of tweets calling off the meeting, citing Russia’s recent actions against Ukraine. White House press secretary Sarah Sanders said Mr. Trump made the decision after a conversation aboard the plane with White House Chief of Staff John Kelly, Secretary of State Mike Pompeo and national security adviser John Bolton, who spoke by phone from Brazil.

President Trump cancelled his meeting with Vladimir Putin over the crisis between Russia and Ukraine. Yet Trump might still want a good relationship with Putin. WSJ's Gerald F. Seib explains. Photo: Getty

Mr. Trump wrote that his cancellation was “based on the fact that the ships and sailors have not been returned to Ukraine from Russia.” He said that he was open to rescheduling his meeting with Mr. Putin “as soon as this situation is resolved!”

The confrontation began when three Ukrainian naval vessels were traveling through the Kerch Strait, which connects the Black Sea to the Sea of Azov. Russia seized the vessels and detained crew members.

The Kremlin hasn’t been officially notified of Mr. Trump’s decision to cancel the meeting with Mr. Putin—but such a move would free up “a couple more hours for useful meetings” for Mr. Putin at the G-20, Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov was cited as saying by Russian news agency Interfax.

Earlier in the week, U.S. Ambassador to the United Nations Nikki Haley warned Russia over the seizure of the ships.

Russian forces fired on and detained three Ukrainian naval vessels in the Black Sea, near the Crimean peninsula, a move that threatened to reignite tensions between Moscow and Kiev. Image: FSB Handout via RTR

Ms. Haley called the incident “yet another reckless Russian escalation” and said it would sour U.S.-Russia relations while increasing tensions with Ukraine. She said her comments had been coordinated with President Trump and Secretary of State Mike Pompeo.

Relations between Ukraine and Russia have been strained since Moscow annexed Crimea in 2014 and supported an armed uprising in eastern Ukraine.

President Trump and first lady Melania Trump before boarding Air Force One on Thursday en route to Argentina. Photo: Pablo Martinez Monsivais/Associated Press

Mr. Trump’s decision to call off the meeting came several hours after his former attorney, Michael Cohen, pleaded guilty to making false statements to Congress last year about efforts to build a Trump Tower in Moscow during the presidential campaign.

Mr. Cohen told Congress he had “limited” discussions about the proposed deal with Mr. Trump. In reality the discussions were “more extensive,” Mr. Cohen said. In comments to reporters Thursday, Mr. Trump said Mr. Cohen was lying in an effort to get a reduced prison sentence.

Mr. Trump has faced criticism from Democrats for appearing deferential to Mr. Putin, despite the U.S. intelligence community’s finding that Russia attempted to influence the 2016 presidential race to help Mr. Trump and damage his opponent, Hillary Clinton. Mr. Trump has denied any collusion with Russia, and Moscow has denied any interference.

Corrections & Amplifications

Vladimir Putin is president of Russia. An editing mistake misidentified Mr. Putin in an earlier version of this article. (Nov. 29)

Write to Peter Nicholas at peter.nicholas@wsj.com
